results.title: Un Chien andalou
results.brief_description: A surrealistic film using symbolic objects and settings designed by Salvador Dali. The film was a collaboration between Bunuel and Dali over 3 days and shot in 2 weeks. A series of seemingly unrelated images are unified by their power to shock. The famed opening sequence was left out some releases by censors. Enthusiastically received by Paris surrealists, the film saw Bunuel and Dali being recognised by their peers, and it still enjoys its innovative arthouse status. Censorship restriction: Suitable only for adults.

results.title: A Hard day's night
results.creator_credit: Richard Lester, Walter Shenson and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: Starring the Beatles, this comic fantasia with music uses a multitude of cinematic gags. An enormous commercial success, it led directly to all the kaleidescope swinging London spy thrillers and comedies of the late sixties. In this film the Beatles, harrased by their manager and Paul’s grandpa, embark from Liverpool by train for a London television show.

results.title: Charmes de l'existence (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Jean Gremillon, Pierre Kast and Films De Saint-Germain-Des-Pres
results.brief_description: French language only. The French Academy is the supreme arbiter of what is often referred to as “official art”, art that paints a surface reality but is in fact the embodiment of those morals, ideas and virtues that have received official sanction. In this film official art has been used to satire the social history of France at the turn of the century - the fashions, foibles, conventions, the glory of battle and triumph of virtue. Utilising canvases of painters who won the Prix de Rome between 1860 to 1914, the film follows the Seven Ages of Man, presenting the official view of a way of life. Award: International Prize for a Short Feature, Venice Film Festival, 1950.

results.title: The Orphan lions
results.creator_credit: Jack Couffer, Carl Foreman, Columbia Pictures and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: An edited version of the feature film “Living free” in which three lion cubs in danger of not surviving after the death of their mother are taken on a journey of 700 miles by two conservationists and set free on the Serengeti Plains in Africa.

results.title: Jack Frost
results.brief_description: Filmed in Russia, this feature-length production of the tale of Jack frost involves many stock characters such as an ugly witch, a cruel stepmother, a long suffering husband, an obnoxious daughter, a mistreated stepdaughter and of course, the “handsome prince”. The prince is in the form of a vain young man who subsequently abandons his narcissistic ways. Originally in Russian; dubbed into English. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: I have a problem with the word 'integration'
results.creator_credit: Lyn Bugden and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: This program aquaints the viewers with the range of disabilities suffered by physically handicaped people. Emphasizes the right of all disabled children to maximize their quality of life and challenges teaches to accept the disabled into a normal classroom.

results.title: Room for one more
results.creator_credit: Barry Milligan and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Victoria Templeton interviews couples who have adopted or fostered disabled children in infancy or early childhood. Discusses the joys and issues surrounding caring for emotionally, physically or intellectually disabled children and emphasises the importance of family relationships.

results.title: Teacher and technology
results.creator_credit: Milton Ingerson, South Australian Film Corporation and U-Tel
results.brief_description: Aims to promote technology awarness in teachers. Changes in needs and methods have led to a greater use of technology in the classroom, especially for self-paced learning. The practical applications of equipment are discussed. Children from four South Australian primary schools participated in the production. Essentially a promotion of the South Australian Educational Technology Centre. It emphasizes the need to teach using 1980s technology. Hardware covered includes over-head projectors, computers, video, film.

results.title: Pete's pigs: a journey through an intensive piggery
results.brief_description: Provides comparison between a mechanized piggery and the traditional method of running a piggery, noting the vast improvements in the control of disease and breeding that have come with automation. No other credits.

results.title: Tale of two cities
results.creator_credit: Ralph Thomas, Betty E. Box and Rank Film Productions
results.brief_description: An adaptation of Charles Dickens’ immortal tale of romance and intrigue set against the lurid background of the French Revolution. Dirk Bogarde stars as Sydney Carlton whose final act of self-sacrifice brings the story to its dramatic end. Also stars Dorothy Tutin and Cecil Parker, Leo McKern, Christopher Lee and Donald Pleasence.
